trans-unit.source: Troubleshoot your local cluster setup
trans-unit.target: Troubleshoot your local cluster setup

trans-unit.source: This article covers a set of suggestions for troubleshooting your local development cluster
trans-unit.target: This article covers a set of suggestions for troubleshooting your local development cluster

trans-unit.source: Troubleshoot your local development cluster setup
trans-unit.target: Troubleshoot your local development cluster setup

trans-unit.source: If you run into an issue while interacting with your local development cluster, review the following suggestions for potential solutions.
trans-unit.target: If you run into an issue while interacting with your local development cluster, review the following suggestions for potential solutions.

trans-unit.source: Cluster setup failures
trans-unit.target: Cluster setup failures

trans-unit.source: Cannot clean up Service Fabric logs
trans-unit.target: Cannot clean up Service Fabric logs

trans-unit.source: Problem
trans-unit.target: Problem

trans-unit.source: While running the DevClusterSetup script, you see an error like this:
trans-unit.target: While running the DevClusterSetup script, you see an error like this:

trans-unit.source: Solution
trans-unit.target: Solution

trans-unit.source: Close the current Powershell window and launch a new Powershell window as an Administrator.
trans-unit.target: Close the current Powershell window and launch a new Powershell window as an Administrator.

trans-unit.source: You should now be able to successfully run the script.
trans-unit.target: You should now be able to successfully run the script.

trans-unit.source: Cluster connection failures
trans-unit.target: Cluster connection failures

trans-unit.source: Type Initialization Exception
trans-unit.target: Type Initialization Exception

trans-unit.source: Problem
trans-unit.target: Problem

trans-unit.source: When connecting to the cluster in PowerShell or Service Fabric Explorer, you see a TypeInitializationException for System.Fabric.Common.AppTrace.
trans-unit.target: When connecting to the cluster in PowerShell or Service Fabric Explorer, you see a TypeInitializationException for System.Fabric.Common.AppTrace.

trans-unit.source: Solution
trans-unit.target: Solution

trans-unit.source: Your path variable was not correctly set during installation.
trans-unit.target: Your path variable was not correctly set during installation.

trans-unit.source: Please log out of Windows and log back in.
trans-unit.target: Please log out of Windows and log back in.

trans-unit.source: This will fully refresh your path.
trans-unit.target: This will fully refresh your path.

trans-unit.source: Cluster connection fails with "Object is closed"
trans-unit.target: Cluster connection fails with "Object is closed"

trans-unit.source: Problem
trans-unit.target: Problem

trans-unit.source: A call to Connect-ServiceFabricCluster fails with an error like this:
trans-unit.target: A call to Connect-ServiceFabricCluster fails with an error like this:

trans-unit.source: Solution
trans-unit.target: Solution

trans-unit.source: Close the current Powershell window and launch a new Powershell window as an Administrator.
trans-unit.target: Close the current Powershell window and launch a new Powershell window as an Administrator.

trans-unit.source: You should now be able to successfully connect.
trans-unit.target: You should now be able to successfully connect.

trans-unit.source: FabricConnectionDeniedException
trans-unit.target: FabricConnectionDeniedException

trans-unit.source: Problem
trans-unit.target: Problem

trans-unit.source: When debugging from Visual Studio, you get a FabricConnectionDeniedException.
trans-unit.target: When debugging from Visual Studio, you get a FabricConnectionDeniedException.

trans-unit.source: Solution
trans-unit.target: Solution

trans-unit.source: This error usually occurs when you try to try to start a service host process manually, rather than allowing the Service Fabric runtime to start it for you.
trans-unit.target: This error usually occurs when you try to try to start a service host process manually, rather than allowing the Service Fabric runtime to start it for you.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that you do not have any service projects set as startup projects in your solution.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that you do not have any service projects set as startup projects in your solution.

trans-unit.source: Only Service Fabric application projects should be set as startup projects.
trans-unit.target: Only Service Fabric application projects should be set as startup projects.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Understand and troubleshoot your cluster with system health reports
trans-unit.target: Understand and troubleshoot your cluster with system health reports

trans-unit.target: Visualizing your cluster with Service Fabric Explorer
